summary: Completed comprehensive backend testing of unified scoring API for Fight Judge AI. All 18 tests passed (100% success rate). The server-authoritative multi-operator scoring system is fully functional.
critical_code_review_comments: Code is well-structured with proper separation of concerns
WebSocket manager properly handles connection lifecycle
Idempotent round computation prevents duplicate scoring
Delta-based scoring system correctly calculates event values
seed_data_creation: Test data created with unique bout IDs prefixed with 'test-' for each test case
context_for_next_testing_agent: Unified scoring backend is fully functional. All endpoints tested: POST /api/events (create events from 4 device roles), GET /api/events (retrieves ALL events without device filter), POST /api/rounds/compute (server-authoritative computation), GET /api/rounds (get all round results), POST /api/fights/finalize (finalize with winner determination). WebSocket /api/ws/unified/{bout_id} is working for real-time updates. Delta scoring system correctly calculates values based on event type and metadata (KD tiers, significant strikes, etc.).
passed_tests: POST /api/events - Knockdown with tier metadata (value calculation)
GET /api/events - Returns ALL events from ALL devices (no filter)
POST /api/rounds/compute - Aggregates events from all 4 devices
POST /api/rounds/compute - Delta scoring system works correctly
POST /api/rounds/compute - Idempotent (same result on multiple calls)
GET /api/rounds - Returns all computed rounds with running totals
Multi-device combination - All 4 device roles combined in scoring
Edge case - Empty round returns 10-10 DRAW
Event value calculation - Correct values for KD tiers, strikes, takedowns

websocket_test_results.state_sync: PASS - Initial state_sync message received on connect
websocket_test_results.broadcast: PASS - Events trigger broadcasts to connected clients
